03968FFCDEA44F34BD8316BCDA2E716C.description: Participate in community service and career awareness activities at the local, state, and national level.

5627979519D84CCD93259288EF60EBBF.description: Participate in FFA intracurricular competitive opportunities at the local, state, and national level.

AB4D356C93064F2E8EDA1BC814C6CD1F.description: Participate in FFA leadership opportunities offered at the local, state, and national level.

C300087609F84446923CF35FA3953E2E.description: Demonstrate knowledge of leadership development through FFA.

60982873718445FFBC083CDBA0256126.description: Foundations of Agriculture, Food, and Natural Resources

67C3EE2FB77741A889A24B1148E95AB5.description:
Research the components and requirements of producing, processing, and selling agricultural products
from the home/farm.

E21B008BD47C42DE960065167766CCEB.description: Identify a current issue or problem in agriculture and work as a group to find a solution to the problem.

99714700CA18474BA70F456E5CB641D9.description:
Identify a current question in agriculture and then develop a hypothesis, conduct research, and present
findings.

3BF5CBFF69D942B795F04691095654F1.description: Identify career opportunities in technology, innovation, and entrepreneurship in agriculture.

8B80D33E78FC4F16A9EEF79D68EF2DEB.description: Describe techniques used in the harvesting of wildlife.

5157525CB5CB42B58AA61294455382A0.description: Identify methods of wildlife habitat improvement.

8ABC3C4CD98446788DF3A7F672637EFC.description: Identify ways in which forest stands may be improved and determine forest harvest timelines.

84F2436E57F74C46BD76E5269A54CD15.description: Demonstrate knowledge of forest and wildlife management.

83DD4E4972C54002980DB6C75C02D787.description: Identify aquatic species including macroinvertebrates, fish, plants, invertebrates, and predator species.

78FECC27767140D1B486966ECF3115F4.description: Identify common tree species and other woody plants in West Virginia.

AB90B055F25247B5B46B8C3FDB387CB2.description: Recognize methods of identifying trees, wildlife, and aquatic species.

D67DEF59FB754C1D9F028F9945CCE015.description: Identify and describe areas of forest wetlands in West Virginia.

213A384912B64C40BC111943970848B1.description: Describe the components of a West Virginia biome.

F3A96F14BC214A4AB91F18BB772F4795.description: Identify the natural resources derived from West Virginia.

74F9242E12484C8094D72929CB097F92.description: Clean or degrease parts, using wire brushes, portable grinders, or chemical baths.

E6CBA6553D204377A947515903E81E28.description: Position and secure work pieces, using hoists, cranes, wire, and banding machines or hand tools.

B012A0990D364E45B5D5A596444D8C28.description: Remove rough spots from work pieces using portable grinders, hand files, or scrapers.

502098854A72469AABEA16EC89917878.description:
Select and install torches, torch tips, filler rods, and flux, according to welding chart specifications or
types and thicknesses of metals.

7B4FB06E1C844929AC9430F738CFE6B3.description:
Connect and turn regulator valves to activate and adjust gas flow and pressure so that desired flames
are obtained.

8EE3B4F3263A4CAFB1D49EC271DDDCF6.description:
Chip or grind off excess weld, slag, or spatter, using hand scrapers or power chippers, portable grinders,
or arc-cutting equipment.

2026EB842BDB4097A6927BD5EE85F860.description:
Lay out, position, align, and secure parts and assemblies prior to assembly, using straightedges,
combination squares, calipers, and rulers.

9D004E589FB744DBA7828011814873A8.description:
Recognize, set up, and operate hand and power tools common to the welding trade, such as shielded
metal arc and gas metal arc welding equipment.

FE9F3363E06245EDA0C61F8781B12FFC.description:
Clamp, hold, tack-weld, heat-bend, grind or bolt component parts to obtain required configurations and
positions for welding.

FD2BFCE6BB7149D1850DB8C5CC64336F.description: Explain the difference between Gas Metal Arc Welding (GMAW) and Flux Core Arc Welding (FCAW).

044745D7FC0549719244BD4E7E65D4FB.description:
Ignite torches or start power supplies and strike arcs by touching electrodes to metals being welded,
completing electrical circuits.

DAABBFBD888041D18BC1B8D8532A46BD.description: Identify types of weld joints including butt, fillet, lap, etc.

1549B0146C0044C6BF3E6B4536D97256.description: Demonstrate knowledge of a safe, properly ventilated welding area.

5F283194283748BCA3882107F12B854B.description: Identify specific PPE needs of welding.

AF4685BDC2414FE78D32B1DA0A2AAC72.description: Identify common safety hazards of welding.

48AA5D6CEFD54BB3893EBE02AAAE8809.description: Remove engines from equipment, and position and bolt engines to repair stands.

C90743DD0B734F409B92A1221C7AEC34.description: Dismantle engines, safely use hand tools, and examine parts for defects.

6AADC9D5B7474FF798AA2A594A311F3C.description:
Repair or replace defective parts such as magnetos, water pumps, gears, pistons, and carburetors, using
hand tools.

7D6D27E1634943659E54B9084938657A.description:
Operate, test and inspect engines to determine malfunctions, to locate missing and broken parts, and to
verify repairs, using diagnostic instruments.

6414B1449E1D44CF92FCD0E7BA6F6F73.description: Obtain problem descriptions from customers and prepare cost estimates for repairs.

AC040F02EAA4496D97DB1805C9A8FB49.description:
Perform routine maintenance such as cleaning and oiling parts, honing cylinders, and tuning ignition
systems.

D770ABA215774C0D82AB1F53E8B70DA1.description: Record repairs made, time spent, and parts used.

0AF30A506C4C4D13BC4372CAE1F9E05C.description:
Reassemble engines after repair or maintenance work is complete and ensure that the reassembled
engine is operational.

C15E8ED545794F3299BC313F8A330223.description: Adjust points, valves, carburetors, distributors, and spark plug gaps, using feeler gauges.

70E281FBCEB04877BDFA0EC061A5BBAE.description:
Repair and maintain gasoline engines used to power equipment such as portable saws, rototillers, lawn
mowers, generators, and compressors.

EE2F35C4041143E2ABBBD313226C092D.description: Demonstrate knowledge of small engine maintenance (e.g., service manuals, fluid levels).

9EE378FFBEFE4270BA37D6CEB5723E75.description: Demonstrate knowledge of the usage of a small engine parts manual.

613E9FD362F448FCAAAB03887954F637.description: Identify the parts of small engine components

C70EA7F3007C4E1EB20C9B07D2093C2F.description: Discuss the cycle of a 4-stroke engine.

783E54E0E0BE4E418F9A4CABDBEBC11B.description: Discuss the cycle of a 2-cycle engine.

8A3110886C514B5EA0222414D2FD1CFF.description: Small Gas Engine Maintenance and Repair

683F6EEC03AA475A8511F428B65AAE8F.description:
Monitor pasture or grazing land use to ensure that livestock are properly fed or that conservation
methods, such as rotational grazing, are used.

2C12F052CC704C078E76D6EEF9A82A9A.description: Research the components of becoming a USDA Certified Organic livestock producer.

721A681849FD43908232B2E735C6B70B.description:
Appraise the adequacy of feed rations using data from the analysis of feedstuffs, animal requirements,
and performance.

1D3D65284F39413FBABCB455103BBB4B.description:
Formulate animal feeds based on nutritional requirements, using feed ingredients for maximum nutrition
and optimal economic production.

639752F138BB4F9AAEDC17FD051902BF.description:
Select appropriate feedstuffs for animals based on factors such as economics, digestive system and
nutritional needs.

17635784EF034485BC54B1DA180A0F3C.description: Study nutritional requirements of animals and nutritive values of animal feed materials.

4BA203C870354B27A8A5BA44C55FFBA0.description: Study effects of feed on quality and quantity of animal products, such as eggs and milk.

A79C50CE4AFF4E81B769041859F08578.description:
Determine nutritional needs of livestock (e.g., essential nutrients, protein, calculate feed, Pearson
Square).

1EC22362C4BF4887A7F25AE8F9E36C70.description:
Assess comparative soil erosion from various planting or tillage systems, such as conservation tillage with mulch or ridge till systems, no-till systems, or conventional tillage systems with or without moldboard
plows.

AB82375A17EE4EF9AC8821D4DB32CE6C.description: Investigate soil problems and poor water quality to determine sources and effects.

33C66797EF3D44EEA852672FB3557842.description:
Investigate responses of soils to specific management practices to determine the use capabilities of soils
and the effects of alternative practices on soil productivity.

0C28FA10A24446BC9D8AB250E3D9E038.description:
Provide information or recommendations to farmers or other landowners regarding ways in which they
can best use land, promote plant growth, or avoid or correct problems such as erosion.

8A3AA32AA6954593AF72A8970B389ED5.description: Describe land capability use (e.g., land capability class, soil management practices).

505E84D0981C4F6EBCD134D301BE8519.description: Explore components of urban and suburban market gardening.

F24A6649F95D42939CE0AA57E0580532.description:
Conduct studies of nitrogen or alternative fertilizer application methods, quantities, or timing to ensure
satisfaction of crop needs and minimization of leaching, runoff, or denitrification.

E2374BC8D8964DC9908B9E27EEB95235.description: Analyze soil to determine types or quantities of fertilizer required for maximum crop production.

FC514EA13AE441B9A5900F5F0CA9E5FE.description: Demonstrate knowledge of soil nutrients (e.g., soil pH, calculate amounts of fertilizer, eutrophication).

2897D77D2CB64205AB2064DEA3D8D146.description:
Study soil characteristics to classify soils on the basis of factors such as geographic location, landscape
position, or soil properties.

7FA7C4971D3341A2B50CDE826F0A8D8D.description: Identify components of soil (e.g., soil texture, soil horizon).

9686FE88D9C540FBB3ACF172045BE2D1.description: Research the requirement of becoming a USDA Certified Organic crop producer.

3388F2605BC74D1995E69D4795F64050.description:
Prepare data summaries, reports, or analyses that include results, charts, or graphs to document
research findings and results.

4514E841AB774DB8A43625038A37C7D4.description:
Perform duties including propagating varieties of plant materials, collecting and germinating seeds, maintaining cuttings of plants, and controlling environmental conditions, and regulating irrigation
systems.

9F9B497C003B49FC9B33876372922947.description:
Plant seeds in specified areas and count the resulting plants to determine the percentage of seeds that
germinated.

4346E5C516354727826E6D07DCE65F1E.description: Prepare soil for planting, and plant or transplant seeds, bulbs, and cuttings.

A4141813AD4F4D2AA5C3B1BD104E5AB9.description:
Demonstrate understanding of soil preparation, propagation techniques, and regulating environmental
conditions in plant production systems.

396DF726C9074369884FF55EFCC842D0.description: Explain the processes and benefits of crop rotation.

C872DF7D868B4C5594072F19CF0A7B99.description: Assess and identify symptoms of crop diseases.

2454741744464A849451A6FFBD4AB855.description: Demonstrate knowledge of the systematic classification of plants.

43014FE81DFC498DA7CABC4043AD82A6.description: Identify plants including herbaceous plants, annual, biennial, and perennial types.
